Spiritual mages are potent magic users in the God Wars Dungeon who require 83 Slayer to kill. Like all monsters in the God Wars Dungeon, they are aggressive to players not wearing items showing affinity to their god, or one of the three types of Ancient equipment.

Spiritual mages are a good source of soul runes, as well as various elemental staves and talismans. In addition, they are currently the only monster to drop dragon boots and gauntlets. They are affected by the buffs of the salve amulet and salve amulet (e).

Armadylean spiritual mages will count towards completing an Aviansie slayer assignment.

    Update history[edit | edit source]

    This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
    • patch 17 April 2023 (Update):
      • Fixed the issue of incorrect souls being captured by Ushabti.
    • patch 11 April 2023 (Update):
      • Can be killed as part of the new undead slayer task.
    • patch 25 July 2022 (Update):
      • Fixed an issue where Spiritual Mages were not affected by aggression potions while the player was more than two tiles away.
    • ninja 26 October 2020 (Update):
      • Monsters with multiple variants will now consistently spawn as those variants when newly placed in the Personal Slayer Dungeon.
        • This includes spiritual warriors, rangers and mages.
    • patch 2 November 2015 (Update):
      • The look of the spiritual mages in the player's vision during Ritual of the Mahjarrat have been brought graphically up to date with their brethren in the God Wars Dungeon.
    • patch 16 February 2015 (Update):
      • Spiritual warriors, mages and rangers no longer count towards automaton slayer tasks.
    • update 5 September 2012 (Update):
      • Spiritual mages have been graphically updated.
    • patch 15 February 2011 (Update):
      • Spiritual mages will no longer play a melee attack animation when attacking familiars with magic.
    • patch 27 January 2009 (Update):
      • Fixed Saradomin spiritual warriors and mages using the wrong attack animations.
    • update 28 August 2007 (Update):
      • Added to game.

    Trivia[edit | edit source]

    • These are the only Slayer monsters assigned by Kuradal that do not drop effigies.
    • Bandosian spiritual mages are unique (along with a few other monsters) in the fact that, although they possess a wander range, they remain static until attacked, in which they will move accordingly to reach their target.
    • Prior to the Evolution of Combat, spiritual mages, like their melee and ranged variants, were unique among each faction:
      • Zamorak's spiritual mages used the Flames of Zamorak spell; although they had the highest magical accuracy, they had the lowest defence and were tied for the least amount of health with Armadyl's spiritual mages.
      • Saradomin's spiritual mages used the Saradomin Strike spell, and had the highest max hit.
      • Bandos' spiritual mages were significantly weaker than the other mages, but made up for this with higher health and defence.
    • As of 1 February 2018, the highest kill count for these monsters was 219,004 kills.[2]
      • This had increased to 234,232 by 6 May 2018.[3]
